properties: Unlike most characters, Mai performs a forward step instead of a dash. Step distance is fixed and cannot be adjusted. Can make it difficult for Mai to make spacing adjustments because of this. May result in a full air combo by the opponent if hit by 5A or 2A. Be careful when dashing close to the opponent. Allows buffering of normals.
May result in a full air combo by the opponent if hit by 5A or 2A. Be careful when dashing close to the opponent.
Allows buffering of normals.
A normal back step. May result in a full air combo by the opponent when trying to do RG in corner but this move accidently comes out.
May result in a full air combo by the opponent when trying to do RG in corner but this move accidently comes out.

framedata.cancel: N SP J IC R SB

properties: Pretty standard jab, can be used as an anti air or to initiate pressure, whiffs on some crouching characters and dps. Thanks to the high hitboxes and fast startup, it's worth using it as a combo starter when confirmed a IAD(instant air dash) or RGed jump normals(usually a 5/6F startup JA). Also can be used to counter standing normals(usually B/C with more than 7F startup) after RG. 2A may do the same thing but 5F startup makes it much harder or impossible. Sometimes RG 5A will not allow for a full combo if it hits, but will surely break the opponent's blockstrings in these circumstances. Rare but helpful to adjust height in combos when the opponent goes too high for 5B to hit.
2A may do the same thing but 5F startup makes it much harder or impossible.
Sometimes RG 5A will not allow for a full combo if it hits, but will surely break the opponent's blockstrings in these circumstances.

framedata.cancel: N SP J IC f5B SB

properties: An incredible move with a very fast startup (close to 5A/2As), fantastic frame advantage, and special hitstop for easy hitconfirms. It is also jump cancellable and links into itself on hit for even easier confirms. Can be used in many, many ways including as an anti air, to blow up both A/B dps on oki and to set up her tk j623A overhead. Due to its speed and hitbox, can be better to mash than 5A/2A on defense. But be aware that you won't have any quick startup normal to do if 5B is RGed. Its biggest weakness is its tendency to come out when you want a f5B, at ranges where it cleanly whiffs. And also sometimes whiffs in combo like 5A5B if not close enough to the opponent.

One of Mai's best disjointed normals, best used as a poke for the opponent to run into, or to interrupt their actions, or a choice of anti air with distance. Its main followups on a ground hit are 6B (techable), 6C, or a full combo if you have Mini Mai summoned with the right spacing. Also functions as a combo part when there is some distance to reach corner to do c5B.

Very bad on whiff, and a decent, but hard to use anti air due to its hurtbox (which extends before the move becomes active) and single anti air active frame. Leads to very strong combos when it catches someone trying to escape the corner by jumping. Also can be followed by 623C when succeeded in doing an anti air in neutral. If the opponent RGs your anti air attempt, the long recovery makes it difficult to counter RG, especially when the opponent is doing a forward air dash. IC or 412C can be used if the counter RG timing is missed.

If the opponent RGs your anti air attempt, the long recovery makes it difficult to counter RG, especially when the opponent is doing a forward air dash. IC or 412C can be used if the counter RG timing is missed.

Mai's only real knockdown normal (6A also knocks down, but will whiff outside of point blank range on a grounded opponent). Can link from a close B (1F link, her only meterless knockdown off a chain combo). Strong hitbox, moves Mai forward, generally advantageous on trade and makes for a good move to throw out as a frame trap. Moves her collision box forward, giving her a left/right teleport mixup midscreen. A good combo and pressure starter in corner. Example: 4C 236A. The move's main weakness is how bad it is when the opponent RGs it.
Moves her collision box forward, giving her a left/right teleport mixup midscreen.
A good combo and pressure starter in corner. Example: 4C 236A.
The move's main weakness is how bad it is when the opponent RGs it.

Anti air slash, does not extend Mai's hurtbox, is jump cancellable. A strong anti air with a slow startup, and the cornerstone of her corner loop. Good at knocking down and producing a mixup chance in midscreen by 412AS. Be careful of the opponent's RG as this move has long recovery.
Be careful of the opponent's RG as this move has long recovery.

Horizontal slash, does not extend Mai's hurtbox. Strong but slow poke, cannot be cancelled without using an IC. Can be crouched by most of the cast. Can also be air teched, even as a single hit. Commonly used as a launcher with red IC (into 6A midscreen for a carry + knockdown, or 665B to a midscreen combo for example), or with Mini Mai instead of IC.
Can be crouched by most of the cast. Can also be air teched, even as a single hit.
Commonly used as a launcher with red IC (into 6A midscreen for a carry + knockdown, or 665B to a midscreen combo for example), or with Mini Mai instead of IC.

Low slash, hits low, can be cancelled into any of her specials/supers. Very common ender to her blockstrings as it allows her to safely summon and continue pressuring, or to teleport to safety. Be aware that some characters with quick ground dash can run into your face if it's cancelled into 623A/412B. Sometimes it's needed to do S to keep frame advantage. Think twice before using it when Mini Mai is not summoned. Keep a lookout for the opponent's forward IAD. If RGed, cancel timing is quite different from normal block(needs to input the command after RG occurs). While this is the same for other normals too, 6C can only be cancelled into specials or supers, making the cancel harder to input.
Be aware that some characters with quick ground dash can run into your face if it's cancelled into 623A/412B. Sometimes it's needed to do S to keep frame advantage.
Think twice before using it when Mini Mai is not summoned. Keep a lookout for the opponent's forward IAD.

If RGed, cancel timing is quite different from normal block(needs to input the command after RG occurs). While this is the same for other normals too, 6C can only be cancelled into specials or supers, making the cancel harder to input.

framedata.cancel: N SP J IC R SB

properties: Standard 2A, hits low, can actually be low profiled by some moves.

Hits low with an ok range, easily loses to other character's normals, especially trying to do this after A or 2A is RGed. Pretty good combo starter if you have an IC on deck. Dash 2B(usually after 214S) is fairly good at catching opponents who just stand/hold back at mid range in neutral or pressure (her other long ranged low, 6C does minimal damage by itself and cannot combo at range).

Mai's longest range normal, fairly slow and extends the hurtbox before its active frames appear, meaning it will lose to many 2Bs. Not really used in neutral, more to push the opponent out during blockstrings and in some advanced combos.

framedata.cancel: N SP J AD IC R

properties: A pretty standard jA angled downwards, good air to ground, can crossup, dubious air to air. It's dangerous to mash JA in IAD because of its slow startup and how easily it can be countered by 4F startup 5A or dps after being RGed. Although technical, it is possible to adjust your height to make the opponent's 5A whiff.

Odd move with fast startup, good hitbox, decent range, but with a really awkward angle, bad recovery on whiff, and sends the opponent further up on hit making full combo conversions extremely finnicky. Full corner conversions off this move are really damaging. Used situationally as a combo part depending on spacing. IAD to jB will whiff on crouching, which can conversely be used to create mixups like IAD jA/jB(whiff) landing 2A or throw or tk623A.
Full corner conversions off this move are really damaging.
Used situationally as a combo part depending on spacing.
IAD to jB will whiff on crouching, which can conversely be used to create mixups like IAD jA/jB(whiff) landing 2A or throw or tk623A.
A weak air to ground move when used as a standalone jump in, very good at crossing up however. Mostly used in her crossup mixups and in combos.
Mostly used in her crossup mixups and in combos.

Puts the opponent in OTG state, making this an excellent unblockable combo starter with BIC or Mini-Mai. However, Mai's slow walking speed limits the situations where she can sneak it in. Mini-Mai pressure helps in this regard (236A oki for example). If Mai is player 1, this throw will knock the opponent down for 0.33 less frames (subtracted from OTG time).
If Mai is player 1, this throw will knock the opponent down for 0.33 less frames (subtracted from OTG time).

variations.notes: Puts the opponent in OTG state, making this an excellent unblockable combo starter with BIC or Mini-Mai. However, Mai's slow walking speed limits the situations where she can sneak it in. Mini-Mai pressure helps in this regard (236A oki for example). If Mai is player 1, this throw will knock the opponent down for 0.33 less frames (subtracted from OTG time).

Puts the opponent in OTG state, making this an excellent unblockable combo starter with BIC or Mini-Mai. However, Mai's slow walking speed limits the situations where she can sneak it in. Mini-Mai pressure helps in this regard (236A oki for example). If Mai is player 1, this throw will knock the opponent down for 0.33 less frames (subtracted from OTG time).

Puts the opponent in OTG state, making this an excellent unblockable combo starter with BIC or Mini-Mai. However, Mai's slow walking speed limits the situations where she can sneak it in. Mini-Mai pressure helps in this regard (236A oki for example). If Mai is player 1, this throw will knock the opponent down for 0.33 less frames (subtracted from OTG time).

properties: A quick throw from direction 9 to direction 1. It's not recommended as a tech trap at the end of combos since it throws the opponent out of corner and Mai won't get enough time to set Mini Mai for oki (412A 6S for example).
If Mini Mai is not summoned and the Charge Gauge is full, 4/5/6S respectively summons her behind/on top/in front of Mai. Notice that 1/2/3S will not work.
If Mini Mai is already summoned, this unsummons her, allowing her Charge Gauge to recover very fast.
Any move that is special cancellable can be cancelled into Set/Recover Mai. The summon/unsummon animation is very quick, allowing Mai to be + when cancelling her C normals.
Unlike most special moves, Set/Recover Mai CANNOT BE BUFFERED. It must be manually timed, similarly to a link.
On summon, Mini Mai actually can act before Mai has recovered from the summoning animation, allowing for strong combos and pressure.
Mini Mai cannot absorb any hit in her neutral state.

variations.notes: Summons Mini Mai behind (4S), on top (5S), or in front (6S) of Mai if the Charge Gauge is full. Very quick animation allows for frame advantage when cancelling from C normals.
If Mini Mai is already summoned, this unsummons her. The Charge Gauge recovers very quickly after using this.

properties: Only available when Mini Mai is not summoned with full Charge Gauge. Summons Mini Mai who performs a combination attack. Button determines attack properties, number of hits, and whether Mini Mai stays summoned afterward.

variations.notes: Comes out very fast (enough to combo off 5B/5C/2C), grants enough frame advantage in corner for airtight dash 2A. Mini Mai disappears after the attack, and Charge Gauge recovers very fast. Useful as a frame trap or to lock down opponent while building meter. Hard to RG the last hit since it has 4 hits. Mini Mai can absorb one hit during the move.
Mai's recovery animation while Mini Mai is attacking. Can be followed up with FIC for more pressure.

Slower than A version with less frame advantage (minus if you dash afterward). Mini Mai stays summoned after attack finishes. Hard to RG last hit due to 4 hits. Useful in advanced combos. Mini Mai can absorb one hit during the move.
Mai's recovery animation during B version. Can FIC for continued pressure.

Slower startup but gives massive frame advantage, especially in corner (enough to easily combo into super). Mini Mai stays summoned afterward. Builds tons of Guard Gauge on block for j623C combo setups. Hard to RG with 16 hits. Mini Mai's absorption is less reliable than A/B version since hurtbox appears after hitbox becomes active.
Mai's recovery animation during C version.

properties: Only available on summoned Mini Mai as long as Mai is not blocking. Mini Mai performs a combination attack, then disappears afterward with long charge recovery.
Similar to 236A but with better frame advantage. Great for locking down the opponent and used in combos to easily link into 236236 supers.
Can build Guard Gauge for tk623C setups. Mini Mai cannot absorb any hit during this move.

variations.notes: Mini Mai performs a combination attack with huge frame advantage, disappearing afterward with a long charge recovery. Great for pressure and combo extensions. 236B 5BC 236S can build enough Guard Gauge for tk623C if there's no RG.
Mai doesn't have any recovery during this move, allowing her to act freely while Mini Mai attacks.

properties: Only available when Mini Mai is not summoned with full Charge Gauge. Summons Mini Mai who performs a tornado attack.
A/B/C version determines where Mini Mai is summoned: A in front of Mai, B at mid range, C at full screen.
Mini Mai disappears after the attack and the Charge Gauge recovers fast. Whiffs on crouching characters.
Works as a decent sniping move in neutral or tech trap. Should follow up with 412A to get in for a combo.

variations.notes: Excellent combo starter (4000+ damage) if the opponent is hit on or close to the ground. Be careful of RG players who will RG first hit and 5A to kill Mini Mai, resulting in long Charge Gauge recovery time.
Mai's recovery animation during the move. Can FIC for continued pressure or combos.

properties: Only available on summoned Mini Mai while Mai is not blocking. Mini Mai performs a rushing attack traveling a long distance.
Mini Mai disappears afterward with long charge recovery. Fast and covers more than half the stage.
Used for neutral sniping and to combo off j623A without spending IC. Hitbox develops a bit after Mini Mai starts moving.
Mini Mai can absorb one hit during this move, making it excellent against most reversals.

variations.notes: Fast rush attack with huge frame advantage. Useful in advanced combos and for negating most reversals with its hit absorption property.
Mai has no recovery during this move and can act freely while Mini Mai attacks.

properties: Only available when Mini Mai is not summoned with full Charge Gauge. Summons Mini Mai who performs an explosion attack.
A/B/C determine where Mini Mai appears: A in front of Mai, B at mid range, C at long range.
Excellent tool in neutral, blockstrings, and oki. Mini Mai stays summoned after the attack.
Gives large frame advantage on block, allowing Mai to dash in or teleport while covered by Mini Mai.

variations.notes: Very strong on oki with two hits making it hard to wake-up RG. Mini Mai can absorb one hit during this move. Be careful with spacing as Mini Mai can be killed by 5A after RG if positioned too close. Some characters with quick ground dash can punish this after 6C, sometimes better to use S instead.
Mai's recovery animation during the move. Can FIC for continued pressure or combos.

properties: Only available on summoned Mini Mai while Mai is not blocking. Mini Mai performs an electric attack.
Mini Mai disappears afterward with short charge recovery. Creates a launcher that reaches further during active frames.
Great for baiting mashing and reversals (4S to set Mini Mai behind you, buffer attack and block).
Used in midscreen oki setups. Does not hit point blank. Mini Mai cannot absorb hits during this move.

variations.notes: Electric launcher attack with good frame advantage. Hitbox becomes thinner and taller over time. Good for midscreen setups and baiting reversals.
Mai has no recovery during this move and can act freely while Mini Mai attacks.

properties: Only available on summoned Mini Mai while Mai is not blocking. Mini Mai performs a tornado attack.
Mini Mai disappears afterward with long charge recovery. Unlike 214*, hits crouching opponents.
Excellent invincible move with very fast startup (4F). Used as an anti-air, to combo off j623A without IC in corner, and for oki.
6S 22S links off c5B, 5C, 6C and 2C for strong meterless damage (extremely hard to do).

variations.notes: When Mini Mai is in opponent's face, confirming opponent's RG and using 22S will counter any mash attempts. Mini Mai can absorb one hit during this move.
Mai has no recovery during this move and can act freely while Mini Mai attacks.

properties: Mai's aerial special move with three distinct versions. Can be performed from tiger knee motion (623+9A) for a quick overhead.

variations.notes: Overhead, can combo with IC or summoned Mini Mai, unsafe on block. A cornerstone of Mai's close range pressure, the tk version (6239A) is a fast overhead that crushes low mashing. Has some i-frames on startup. Whiffs on crouching characters with low hurtbox when not close enough.

Faster and safer on block than A version, not an overhead. Can be comboed without IC or Mini Mai. Visually similar to A, crushes lows, and has great hitbox that beats some anti-airs. Has some i-frames on startup. Good option during backward air dash if opponent tries to catch you with a ground attack.

Very fast, invincible, overhead that launches the opponent high up. Will beat almost all anti-air options. Extremely fast as an overhead mixup. Can only combo after building up opponent's Guard Gauge. Has a gimmick where hitting with only the last active frame launches similar to B version.

properties: Mai's teleport and attack special. Different versions provide various teleport positions and follow-up attacks.

variations.notes: Mai teleports on the ground: A puts her next to the opponent, B at mid range. Useful cancel option at the end of pressure strings from 6C or 4C. Can be beaten by quick ground dashes or fast traveling moves.

Mai teleports and performs a low sliding kick. Hits low and can combo with IC or Mini Mai. Good for corner pressure against opponents expecting throw/overhead, or when opponent tends to jump with Mini Mai in their face. Mai is invincible while teleporting but hurtbox appears 4F before hitbox.

Mai teleports above opponent with a downwards slash. Air unblockable but not an overhead. Tracks opponent's position. Good when opponent is likely to jump during pressure, especially when escaping corner. Despite appearance, does NOT hit behind her. Hurtbox appears 12F before hitbox, making it risky against air attacks.

Different from other versions - not a teleport but a dash with a hitbox. Mai's main reversal with invincible startup (can trade). OTG combos possible on trade. Good for knockdown after chain combo, but will whiff if chain pushes opponent too far. Strong against ground moves but weak to jumping attacks due to hurtbox placement.

properties: Mai teleports forward, with a hitbox following behind her. One of Mai's few reversals.
The higher the level, the slower the startup and the longer the distance traveled.
Punishable by 5A/2A on block or throw after RG. Long invincibility makes it useful against ground supers.

variations.notes: Shortest teleport distance. Good combo ender to build IC and Charge Gauge. Hitbox extends behind starting position allowing cross-up against jump-ins or as oki. Keep Mini Mai summoned as backup when blocked. Whiffs on some ground moves due to narrow vertical hitbox.
Medium teleport distance. Can be used to punish opponent's normals after Mai's normals are RGed. Difficult to combo from simple chains without IC or Mini Mai.

Longest teleport distance. Used for big damage in midscreen where Mai has limited combo options, especially round-ending situations. Will not cause damage when hitting armor, moving to whiff motion instead.

properties: Only available when Mini Mai is not summoned with full Charge Gauge. Mini Mai creates a powerful fireball.
Higher levels create larger fireballs with more hits and damage. Mini Mai disappears afterward with long charge recovery.
Primarily used with C version in maximum damage BIC combos. Also effective against armored characters.
Mini Mai is invincible during all versions of this move.

variations.notes: Smallest fireball version. Mini Mai is invincible during the move.
Mai's recovery animation during A version.
Medium fireball version. Can substitute for C version in BIC combos with higher Power requirement.
Mai's recovery animation during B version.
Largest fireball with most hits. Primarily used with BIC for maximum damage combos.
Mai's recovery animation during C version.

properties: Only available on summoned Mini Mai while Mai is not blocking. Mini Mai fires multiple slow-moving single-hit fireballs.
Higher levels fire more projectiles. Each fireball's vertical position is random, making it somewhat unreliable in combos.
Great for corner pressure (especially at level 3) and forcing advantageous neutral situations.
Blocking all fireballs builds Guard Gauge for tk623C combos. Mini Mai is invincible during the move.

variations.notes: Button determines number of fireballs. Several stable combos exist using A or B versions. Mini Mai disappears after the move with long charge recovery.
Mai's recovery animation during the move. Relatively quick, allowing Mai to act while fireballs are still active.

properties: Only available with Mini Mai charged but unsummoned, 3 SP bars, and less than 1/3rd HP remaining.
Mai transforms into Awakened Mai with brief invincibility (not enough to be a viable reversal).
Charge Gauge recovers for 400 frames after leaving this form. Time gauge slowly drains while active.
Mai stays in awakened mode as long as Time remains (even between rounds). Loses access to Mini Mai moves.
RF moves no longer cost meter, instead using ~10% Time gauge. Mai's dash becomes extremely fast (10F).
Mai cannot build SP meter while awakened. Gains access to several new moves listed separately.

variations.notes: Activates Awakened Mai state. Button choice doesn't affect the transformation.

properties: Only available in Awakened Mai mode. Replaces normal Scattering attacks.
Each slash becomes jump cancellable, untechable, advantageous on block, with improved recovery and startup.
Costs 10% Time gauge per slash used. 6C cannot be cancelled into specials and launches on hit.

variations.notes: Can be used after 412C for a safe reversal without RF gauge cost (412C uses Time Gauge instead). Any hit into Scattering Zero Style leads to easy 6B loops.
412A(hold) 6B can lead to combo without IC. Excellent for frame traps and pressure.
Unlike normal 6C, this cannot be cancelled into specials but launches on hit. Still excellent for pressure and frame traps.

properties: Only available in Awakened Mai mode. Creates an air-unblockable, untechable pillar of light.
Button determines position. Costs ~10% Time Gauge. Very fast startup.
Excellent for catching opponents trying to escape. Hitbox becomes thinner and taller over time.

variations.notes: Position varies with button choice. Can be FICed for combos but difficult to convert from.
Mai's recovery animation during A/B versions.
Similar to A/B but with better frame advantage on block.
Mai's recovery animation during C version.

moves.moveName: The Heart That Has Accepted It All
properties: Only available in Awakened Mai mode. A unique throw super that works even when opponent is in prejump or grounded hitstun.

variations.notes: Works even when opponent is in prejump or grounded hitstun, making it a true command grab super.
The hit effect if it connects. Very unsafe on block.
